results.title: Street of shame = Akasen chitai [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Janus Films
results.brief_description: The setting is a Tokyo brothel, ironically called Dreamland. The content is the thoughts, disappointments and aspirations of the occupants. This was Mizoguchi’s final film, and one in which he returned to his earlier theme of the exploitation of women throughout the ages. He does so by integrating the stories of five prostitutes which covers the roles of women as daughters, mothers and wives. Many believe that this film was pivotal in the 1957 decision to abolish prostitution in Japan. Cast includes Daisuke Kato, Machiko Kyo and Aiko Mimasu.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Janus Films

results.title: Alice in wonderland
results.creator_credit: Nick Willing, Dyson Lovell, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: After running away from home, Alice steps into a rabbit hole and enters an incredible magical world full of adventure. Originally produced for television, this adaptation of the Lewis Carroll classic features an impressive cast and special effects from Frame Store and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop. Cast includes Robbie Coltrane, Whoopi Goldberg, Ben Kingsley, Christopher Lloyd, Martin Short and many more.

results.title: Master of the house = Du skal aere din hustru: thou shalt honour thy wife
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Palladium Films
results.brief_description: Since the collapse of his business, Victor (Meyer) has grown increasingly morose, ill tempered, selfish and demanding. Unaware of the plight of his wife and three children to keep the family fed and clothed, Victor persists in treating his wife harshly, and her health deteriorates. To aid her recovery, Victor’s wife is sent away from the home duties that have burdened her for so long. In exchange, Victor’s old nanny moves in, and treating him as if he was the age when she initially cared for him, shows him the path towards self recognition and amends his cruel ways. Cast includes Johannes Meyer, Astrid Holm, Mathilde Nielson and Clara Schonfeld.

results.title: High and low = Tengoku to jigoku [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Ryuzo Kikushima, Tomoyuki Tanaka and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: In the first half a kidnapping takes place and a ransom is negotiated; the second half deals with the manhunt for the kidnapper. The Japanese title - Heaven and Hell - directly suggests exact opposites and more clearly encapsulates the theme. It begins in ‘Heaven’ - the apartment high over the city - and ends in ‘Hell’ - the alleyways of Yokohama. The first half is superficially theatrical in its refusal of conventional editing strategies but actually is notable for its subtle dramatic geometry involving permutations of position and composition afforded by the Scope screen. Multiple cameras were used to film long takes. The film suddenly opens out into an action-packed chase. Based on the novel “King’s Ransom” by Ed McBain. Cast includes Toshiro Mifune, Tatsuya Nakadai, Kyoko Kagawa. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Ugetsu Monogatari = Tales of the pale and silvery moon after the rain
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: An unforgettably haunting film in every sense, this film is adapted from two stories in a collection of ghostly tales by the eighteenth-century writer Akinari Ueda, and Guy De Maupassant. Genjuro, a poor potter trying to make a living in a war-torn medieval village, is lured away from his devoted wife and young son by the mysterious Lady Wasaka who turns out to be a ghost. When Genjuro returns home repentant, his wife, too, has become a ghost after being murdered by stragglers weary from battle. Mizoguchi’s depiction of the past is vivid, richly detailed but not in the least romantic. For all its panache, the age he shows us is one of cruelty, oppression, and often appalling casual brutality. Cast includes Masayuki Mori, Kinuyo Tanaka and Machiko Kyo. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Love is the devil: study for a portrait of Francis Bacon
results.creator_credit: John Maybury, Chiara Menage, British Film Institute and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Love is the Devil: A Study For A Portrait of Francis Bacon is indeed a portrait in the style of controversial British painter Bacon. Like Bacon’s confronting yet compelling portraits, John Maybury’s film intensely focuses on its subject - revelling in distortion and pain. The film follows the turbulent, sado-masochistic relationship Bacon (Derek Jacobi) had with George Dwyer (Daniel Craig), who he meets when he accidently stumbles upon Dwyer attempting to burgle Bacon’s meagre apartment. Francis simply says to George: “Take off your clothes. Come to bed and you can have whatever you want”. The relationship has a destructive effect on the passive George who feels uncomfortable with Bacon’s eccentric friends (Tilda Swinton is especially creepy as one of this coterie), and who is continually tortured by Bacon’s sadistic enjoyment of pain and suffering. Derek Jacobi and Daniel Craig are excellent as the two main characters.

results.title: Closely observed trains = Ostre sledovane vlaky
results.creator_credit: Jiri Menzel, Zdenek Oves and Barrandov Studios
results.brief_description: During the German occupation, a young man, Milos, (Vaclav Neckar) works as a trainee railway guard in a country station. He has only one thing on his mind; to lose his virginity, possibly with the wife of the station master (Libuse Havelkova). His attempts take him through the trauma of premature ejaculation, an attempted suicide and finally success with a member of the Underground Movement, before tragedy strikes. ‘Closely observed trains’ is adapted from a novel by Bohumil Hrabal. This film is one of the finest achievements of the Czech ‘New Wave’ and was the second Czech film to win an Oscar for best foreign film in 1967. The film was banned after the Soviet invasion of 1968 as ‘pornographic’. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: French cancan
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Louis Wipf and Franco London Film (Paris)
results.brief_description: Beautifully photographed, this comedy-drama chronicles the revival of Paris’ most notorious dance as it tells the story of a theater producer who turns a humble washerwoman into a star at the Moulin Rouge. Renoir’s return to film-making in France after 15 years absence is an exuberant, affectionate homage to the theatre of ‘La Belle Epoque’ (Edith Piaf and Tatachou appear briefly as stars of the day.) It also gave him the opportunity to work with Gabin again, having made three films with him in the 1930s. Cast includes Jean Gabin, Francoise Arnoul and Maria Felix. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: My night with Maud = ma nuit chez Maud
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Pierre Cottrell and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Six contes moraux = Six moral tales”.
Jean Louis, a Catholic engineer smug in his acceptance of a Pascalian wager about faith, finds his beliefs challenged by an encounter with Maud, a free-thinking divorcee. She represents desire while Francoise - who he has observed from a distance at Mass - seems to represent, for him, a path to the attainment of grace. The ambiguous conflict between instinct and reason, nature and culture is worked through in this sharply observed comedy of manners, the third of Rohmer’s moral tales (filmed out of sequence), and set in a wintry Clermont-Ferrand. Although there are many ironic moments, Rohmer’s refusal to displace ambiguity with irony allows space for the viewer to find his/her own way through the thicket created between what is observed and the rationalisation of the narrator. Cast includes Jean-Louise Trintignant, Francoise Fabian, Marie-Christine Barrault and Antoine Vitez. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: It happened here
results.creator_credit: Andrew Mollo, Kevin Brownlow and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This is an imaginative realisation of a German occupation of Britain in July, 1940: Pauline Murray, an Irish girl working in England, joins up in 1944 with the re-emerging Resistance. On a 7,000 pound budget the filmmakers’ recreated a newsreel style but did not use stock or newsreel footage, a direct reaction to fifties war movies which they felt never dealt with the nature of Nazism. A controversial sequence showed real British Nazis expressing their beliefs. The documentary style drama took eight years to complete.
